verses.verse: Then <S%H6030>answered<s%> <S%H464>Eliphaz<s%> the <S%H8489>Temanite<s%>, and <S%H559>said<s%>,
Should a wise <S%H2450>man<s%> <S%H6030>utter<s%> <S%H7307>vain<s%> <S%H1847>knowledge<s%>, and <S%H4390>fill<s%> his <S%H990>belly<s%> with the east <S%H6921>wind<s%>? vain: Heb. knowledge of wind
Should he <S%H3198>reason<s%> with <S%H5532>unprofitable<s%> <S%H1697>talk<s%>? or with <S%H4405>speeches<s%> wherewith he can do no <S%H3276>good<s%>?
Yea, thou castest <S%H6565>off<s%> <S%H3374>fear<s%>, and <S%H1639>restrainest<s%> <S%H7881>prayer<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H410>God<s%>. castest: Heb. makest void prayer: or, speech
For thy <S%H6310>mouth<s%> <S%H502>uttereth<s%> thine <S%H5771>iniquity<s%>, and thou <S%H977>choosest<s%> the <S%H3956>tongue<s%> of the <S%H6175>crafty<s%>. uttereth: Heb. teacheth
Thine own <S%H6310>mouth<s%> <S%H7561>condemneth<s%> thee, and not I: yea, thine own <S%H8193>lips<s%> <S%H6030>testify<s%> against thee.
Art thou the <S%H7223>first<s%> <S%H7223><s%> <S%H120>man<s%> that was <S%H3205>born<s%>? or wast thou <S%H2342>made<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H1389>hills<s%>?
Hast thou <S%H8085>heard<s%> the <S%H5475>secret<s%> of <S%H433>God<s%>? and dost thou <S%H1639>restrain<s%> <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> to thyself?
What <S%H3045>knowest<s%> thou, that we <S%H3045>know<s%> not? what <S%H995>understandest<s%> thou, which is not in us?
With us are both the <S%H7867>grayheaded<s%> and very <S%H3453>aged<s%> men, <S%H3524>much<s%> <S%H3117>elder<s%> than thy <S%H1>father<s%>.
Are the <S%H8575>consolations<s%> of <S%H410>God<s%> <S%H4592>small<s%> with thee? is there any <S%H328>secret<s%> <S%H1697>thing<s%> with thee?
Why doth thine <S%H3820>heart<s%> carry thee <S%H3947>away<s%>? and what do thy <S%H5869>eyes<s%> wink <S%H7335>at<s%>,
That thou <S%H7725>turnest<s%> thy <S%H7307>spirit<s%> against <S%H410>God<s%>, and lettest such <S%H4405>words<s%> go <S%H3318>out<s%> of thy <S%H6310>mouth<s%>?
What is <S%H582>man<s%>, that he should be <S%H2135>clean<s%>? and he which is <S%H3205>born<s%> of a <S%H802>woman<s%>, that he should be <S%H6663>righteous<s%>?
Behold, he putteth no <S%H539>trust<s%> in his <S%H6918>saints<s%>; yea, the <S%H8064>heavens<s%> are not <S%H2141>clean<s%> in his <S%H5869>sight<s%>.
How much more <S%H8581>abominable<s%> and <S%H444>filthy<s%> is <S%H376>man<s%>, which <S%H8354>drinketh<s%> <S%H5766>iniquity<s%> <S%H5766><s%> like <S%H4325>water<s%>?
I will <S%H2331>shew<s%> thee, <S%H8085>hear<s%> me; and that which I have <S%H2372>seen<s%> I will <S%H5608>declare<s%>;
Which <S%H2450>wise<s%> men have <S%H5046>told<s%> from their <S%H1>fathers<s%>, and have not <S%H3582>hid<s%> it:
Unto whom alone the <S%H776>earth<s%> was <S%H5414>given<s%>, and no <S%H2114>stranger<s%> <S%H5674>passed<s%> <S%H8432>among<s%> them.
The <S%H7563>wicked<s%> man <S%H2342>travaileth<s%> with pain all his <S%H3117>days<s%>, and the <S%H4557>number<s%> of <S%H8141>years<s%> is <S%H6845>hidden<s%> to the <S%H6184>oppressor<s%>.
A <S%H6343>dreadful<s%> <S%H6963>sound<s%> is in his <S%H241>ears<s%>: in <S%H7965>prosperity<s%> the <S%H7703>destroyer<s%> shall <S%H935>come<s%> upon him. A dreadful: Heb. A sound of fears
He <S%H539>believeth<s%> not that he shall <S%H7725>return<s%> out of <S%H2822>darkness<s%>, and he is <S%H6822>waited<s%> for of the <S%H2719>sword<s%>.

He wandereth <S%H5074>abroad<s%> for <S%H3899>bread<s%>, saying, Where is it? he <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> that the <S%H3117>day<s%> of <S%H2822>darkness<s%> is <S%H3559>ready<s%> at his <S%H3027>hand<s%>.
<S%H6862>Trouble<s%> and <S%H4691>anguish<s%> shall make him <S%H1204>afraid<s%>; they shall <S%H8630>prevail<s%> against him, as a <S%H4428>king<s%> <S%H6264>ready<s%> to the <S%H3593>battle<s%>.
For he stretcheth <S%H5186>out<s%> his <S%H3027>hand<s%> against <S%H410>God<s%>, and <S%H1396>strengtheneth<s%> himself against the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%>.
He <S%H7323>runneth<s%> upon him, even on his <S%H6677>neck<s%>, upon the <S%H5672>thick<s%> <S%H1354>bosses<s%> of his <S%H4043>bucklers<s%>:
Because he <S%H3680>covereth<s%> his <S%H6440>face<s%> with his <S%H2459>fatness<s%>, and <S%H6213>maketh<s%> collops of <S%H6371>fat<s%> on his <S%H3689>flanks<s%>.
And he <S%H7931>dwelleth<s%> in <S%H3582>desolate<s%> <S%H5892>cities<s%>, and in <S%H1004>houses<s%> which no man <S%H3427>inhabiteth<s%>, which are <S%H6257>ready<s%> to become <S%H1530>heaps<s%>.

He shall not be <S%H6238>rich<s%>, neither shall his <S%H2428>substance<s%> <S%H6965>continue<s%>, neither shall he <S%H5186>prolong<s%> the <S%H4512>perfection<s%> thereof upon the <S%H776>earth<s%>.

He shall not <S%H5493>depart<s%> out of <S%H2822>darkness<s%>; the <S%H7957>flame<s%> shall dry <S%H3001>up<s%> his <S%H3127>branches<s%>, and by the <S%H7307>breath<s%> of his <S%H6310>mouth<s%> shall he go <S%H5493>away<s%>.
Let not him that is <S%H8582>deceived<s%> <S%H539>trust<s%> in <S%H7723>vanity<s%>: for <S%H7723>vanity<s%> shall be his <S%H8545>recompence<s%>.
It shall be <S%H4390>accomplished<s%> <S%H3808>before<s%> his <S%H3117>time<s%>, and his <S%H3712>branch<s%> shall not be <S%H7488>green<s%>. accomplished: or, cut off
He shall shake <S%H2554>off<s%> his unripe <S%H1154>grape<s%> as the <S%H1612>vine<s%>, and shall cast <S%H7993>off<s%> his <S%H5328>flower<s%> as the <S%H2132>olive<s%>.
For the <S%H5712>congregation<s%> of <S%H2611>hypocrites<s%> shall be <S%H1565>desolate<s%>, and <S%H784>fire<s%> shall <S%H398>consume<s%> the <S%H168>tabernacles<s%> of <S%H7810>bribery<s%>.
They <S%H2029>conceive<s%> <S%H5999>mischief<s%>, and bring <S%H3205>forth<s%> <S%H205>vanity<s%>, and their <S%H990>belly<s%> <S%H3559>prepareth<s%> <S%H4820>deceit<s%>. vanity: or, iniquity
